Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2013 12:48PM Obieann wrote: Has anyone had the new test mamma print. It looks at 72 genes as opposed to the 20 that oncotyping looks at. It also separates luminal A and Lumimnal B. It categorizes 10 year recurrence risk into high and low and doesn't have a intermediate category. Here's an example of how cancer treatment can so often lag behind the science. Mamma print will soon become the gold standard when scientific data at conferences starts to create a tipping point
Posts.Title: anyone not get an oncotype test? kika2013 Cathymck
